text: D. W. B. and Julia Waddell Tevis House is a historic home located at Lexington, Lafayette County, Missouri. It was built about 1868, and is a two- story, cruciform plan, Italianate style brick dwelling. It features a roofline embellished with hefty modillions (or mini-brackets) and twin Queen Anne porches. Also on the property is the contributing small, frame outbuilding. (includes 12 photographs from 1991) It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1993. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:Italianate architecture in Missouri Category:Queen Anne architecture in Missouri Category:Houses completed in 1868 Category:Houses in Lafayette County, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Lafayette County, Missouri
title: D. W. B. and Julia Waddell Tevis House
